description: |-
  The f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer resource manages TCP Load Balancers in F5 Distributed Cloud.
  TCP Load Balancers distribute incoming TCP traffic across origin pools based on
  configured rules and policies. They operate at Layer 4 and handle raw TCP connections.
  Example Usage
  
  resource "f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer" "example" {
    name        = "my-tcp-lb"
    namespace   = "my-namespace"
    description = "Example TCP Load Balancer"
  
    domains     = ["tcp.example.com"]
    listen_port = 3306
  
    origin_pools {
      pool_name      = f5distributedcloud_origin_pool.mysql.name
      pool_namespace = "my-namespace"
      weight         = 1
      priority       = 1
    }
  
    advertise_on_public = true
  }

  TCP Load Balancers can be imported using namespace/name:
  
  terraform import f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer.example my-namespace/my-tcp-lb

# f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer (Resource)

The `f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer` resource manages TCP Load Balancers in F5 Distributed Cloud.

TCP Load Balancers distribute incoming TCP traffic across origin pools based on
configured rules and policies. They operate at Layer 4 and handle raw TCP connections.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer" "example" {
  name        = "my-tcp-lb"
  namespace   = "my-namespace"
  description = "Example TCP Load Balancer"

  domains     = ["tcp.example.com"]
  listen_port = 3306

  origin_pools {
    pool_name      = f5distributedcloud_origin_pool.mysql.name
    pool_namespace = "my-namespace"
    weight         = 1
    priority       = 1
  }

  advertise_on_public = true
}
```

## Import

TCP Load Balancers can be imported using namespace/name:

```shell
terraform import f5distributedcloud_tcp_loadbalancer.example my-namespace/my-tcp-lb
```



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `domains` (List of String) List of domains this TCP load balancer serves.
- `listen_port` (Number) TCP port to listen on.
- `name` (String) Name of the TCP Load Balancer.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the TCP Load Balancer is created.

### Optional

- `advertise_on_public` (Boolean) Advertise on public network.
- `advertise_on_public_default_vip` (Boolean) Advertise on public network with default VIP.
- `description` (String) Description of the TCP Load Balancer.
- `dns_volterra_managed` (Boolean) DNS managed by Volterra.
- `hash_policy_choice_least_active` (Boolean) Use least active hash policy for load balancing.
- `hash_policy_choice_random` (Boolean) Use random hash policy for load balancing.
- `hash_policy_choice_source_ip` (Boolean) Use source IP hash policy for load balancing (sticky sessions).
- `idle_timeout` (Number) Idle timeout in milliseconds. Default is 3600000 (1 hour).
- `origin_pools` (Block List) List of origin pools for this TCP load balancer. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--origin_pools))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the TCP Load Balancer.

<a id="nestedblock--origin_pools"></a>
### Nested Schema for `origin_pools`

Required:

- `pool_name` (String) Name of the origin pool.
- `pool_namespace` (String) Namespace of the origin pool.

Optional:

- `priority` (Number) Priority for failover. Lower values are higher priority. Default is 1.
- `weight` (Number) Weight for load balancing. Default is 1.
